name: (EXP) Fuel, Auto / Jet
content:
Despite what movies will have you believe, it's not easy to set jet fuel ablaze. Standard automotive fuel doesn’t burn in liquid form, but fumes do, and the heat of a flame is more than enough to start the surface of a liquid slick evaporating.

The blast radius is also on fire for 3d6 minutes. Any target moving into an affected area on its turn or any target beginning its turn in an affected area suffers the basic damage of the fuel (1d6 or 1d8).
